question_sentence: A record-breaking total of how many migrants crossed the Channel in small boats to reach British shores on Wednesday, according to Home Office data?
Which world leader has angered Russia by demanding answers from the Kremlin over the “attempted murder” of Vladimir Putin critic Alexei Navalny?
The shooting of unarmed black man Jacob Blake has sparked unrest in Kenosha, a city in which US state?

Dominic Cummings has kicked off his “overhaul” of the civil service by relocating 10 Downing Street’s top team to a new “control centre” in 70 Whitehall, which is the current home of which government department?
The BBC has reversed its decision to ban singing during the performance of Rule, Britannia! at The Last Night of the Proms, but who composed the music of the famous song?
A last-minute rush to take advantage of the Eat Out to Help Out scheme brought the total number of discounted meals sold to UK diners in August to how much?
Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have signed a multimillion dollar deal to make documentaries, films and children’s shows with which media company?
Chancellor Rishi Sunak was reported this week to be considering hiking corporation tax from 19% to 24%, a move that experts estimated could raise how much next year?
People with which pre-existing condition account for a quarter of all Covid-related deaths in England and Wales, according to a new study?
Danish striker Pernille Harder is reported to have signed for Chelsea from Wolfsburg for a “record transfer fee for the women’s game” of how much?
The first Labor Day parade was held in what major city in 1882?
evidence: About 10,000 workers participated in the New York City parade on September 5th, 1882. That date is the reason Labor Day is always held on the first Monday of September.

question_sentence: Why did the workers who paved the way for Labor Day choose the month of September?
choices: It’s when children return to school
It was good weather for marches and strikes
It is halfway between Independence Day and Thanksgiving
It is the beginning of the fourth fiscal quarter of the year
evidence: Around the time the idea of Labor Day took hold, most union workers only got days off on Christmas, the 4th of July and some Sundays.

question_sentence: Which president officially made Labor Day a national holiday?
evidence: Grover Cleveland made Labor Day a national holiday in 1894.

question_sentence: The creation of Labor Day didn’t mean fair labor laws were suddenly the norm. Which president passed laws that established the eight-hour workday and ended child labor?
evidence: In 1938, Roosevelt signed into law the Depression-era set of laws known as the The Fair Labor Standards Act.

question_sentence: The “other Labor Day,” as it is considered, is May Day, also known as International Workers’ Day. It is typically a time of protest and activism for workers around the world. What disastrous event does May Day commemorate?
choices: The Triangle Shirtwaist Factory fire, an industrial disaster in New York City in 1911
The Battle of the Viaduct, a deadly clash between striking workers and federal troops in Chicago in 1877
The Haymarket Affair, a bombing during a peaceful worker’s rally in Chicago in 1886
The Thibodaux Massacre, in which townspeople murdered dozens -- and possibly hundreds -- of Black sugar cane workers striking for better conditions
evidence: International Workers’ Day commemorates the Haymarket Affair of 1886. However, the event was considered too controversial to serve as the basis for a national labor holiday.

question_sentence: About what share of working Americans are part of a labor union as of 2019?
evidence: About 10.3% of workers were part of a union in 2019, according to the US Bureau of Labor Statistics. In 1983, the union membership rate was 20.1%

question_sentence: What is the largest single labor union in the US?
choices: National Education Association of the United States
evidence: The National Education Association of the United States has more than 3 million members, according to the Department of Labor. They include teachers but also bus drivers, librarians, cafeteria workers, school nurses and other positions.

question_sentence: Why do people always say you can’t wear white after Labor Day?
choices: White was a shade used by labor activists
It is the end of wedding season
Historically, heavier winter fabrics weren’t produced in white
No one knows, but it probably started with some rich people
evidence: It’s not clear how this outdated rule of fashion etiquette began, but experts point to the changing weather in fashion capitals and the fact that white was a popular shade of summer resort wear among the elites.
